required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of Cellular DNA Repair Capacity in Human Preimplantation Embryos

lead_sponsor.agency: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: The mail aim of the present study is to use molecular methods to analyze the ability of human preimplantation embryos to repair their DNA

detailed_description.textblock: The main aim of the present study is to investigate the DNA repair pathways of preimplantation embryos, examining the events that take place following induction of a DSB at a unique targeted site. The investigators aim to address questions concerning the functionality of the DNA repair mechanism(s) in developing embryos, before and after genome activation.

primary_outcome.measure: repair of double strand break in DNA
primary_outcome.description: targeted deep sequencing to identify the presence of the double strand break in the DNA and subsequent repair ability of the embryo

arm_group.description: healthy male and female game donors to undergo routine gamete donation process
Couples undergoing routine IVF to treat their infertility

intervention.description: an induction of a double strand break will be made in the embryos generated for this research and the repair mechanism observed

study_pop.textblock: Healthy volunteer subjects will be recruiting from amongst the gamete donor population and patients undergoing in vitro fertilization (IVF) for treatment of their infertility

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- gamete donors: be at least 21 years of age, in good health and eligible to donate their games through the standard gamete donation programs
- IVF couples: any couples proceeding with a routine IVF cycle
Exclusion Criteria:
- less than 21 years of age
- inability to provide informed consent

facility.name: Reproductive Medicine Assoicates of New Jersey
